name: Alternate-flowered Watermilfoil

Identifying Characteristics: Leaves: reddish color, two types: submersed – small finely feather divided (1cm long), 3-7 leaflet pairs, arranged in strict whorls of 3-5 leaves; emergent (bracts) – lance-shaped, smooth or slightly serrated, same length or longer than flowers
Flowers: midsummer, tiny in axils of bracts on emergent spike (~5cm above water), alternate arrangement
Other: may hybridize with other milfoils
Habitat: Prefer quiet waters of lakes and streams
Range: Native Range: Maine, New England, northern portion of eastern United States

tags: plants with finely-divided leaves on stems
